metadata.title: CVE-2017-2666 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: It was discovered in Undertow that the code that parsed the HTTP request line permitted invalid characters. This could be exploited, in conjunction with a proxy that also permitted the invalid characters but with a different interpretation, to inject data into the HTTP response. By manipulating the HTTP response the attacker could poison a web-cache, perform an XSS attack, or obtain sensitive information from requests other than their own.

criterions.comment: undertow package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.18-1').
